The Department of Family Medicine is celebrating its 50th anniversary since it was founded back in 1975. Over the course of our 50th year, we will tell the stories of our people, our places and our partners who have worked with us to serve our communities by leading in Family Medicine education, research and care.

Why not celebrate with us and share this video?

Thank you!

In September, a delegation including Marion Dove, Fanny Hersson-Edery and Regina Husa donned their hard hats and ventured to the site of the new H√¥pital de Vaudreuil-Soulanges to check on its progress. 

The future hospital will be a training site for McGill students and residents, providing a valuable new clinical site for our growing cohorts. Slated to open in late 2026, the community hospital will include 404 inpatient beds as well as a 41-stretcher emergency department and 11 operating rooms.

We want to say a big thank you to everyone who attended our Annual Department Retreat, celebrating 50 years of Family Medicine at McGill!

We experienced panels of interesting speakers, stimulating workshops, photos from the 25th anniversary and prizes of books authored by our Department members. But mostly, we reveled in seeing colleagues and friends, while learning and sharing together.

Photo credit: Owen Egan and Joni Dufour.
